Dengue virus (DENV) and chikungunya virus (CHIKV) are arboviruses that cause ongoing epidemics in several countries of Latin America. DENV belongs to the Flaviviridae family and CHIKV is an alphavirus of the Togaviridae family. Both viruses are transmitted by mosquitoes of the genus Aedes (mainly Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus) and during the acute phase they may cause similar nonspecific febrile syndromes that can progress to severe or debilitating conditions.
